title: The Carpet
description: Michael's office becomes the victim of an odorous prank which subjects the office to his punishment.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [catching Jim looking at him at Pam's desk] What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, nothing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam's on vacation and she gets back tomorrow, so it'll be nice to see her.  It'll be nice, and, uh, she set a date for the wedding with Roy.  Uh... June.  Summer.  So, that'll be nice.  And that's that.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [again catching Jim looking at him] What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, nothing.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Jim's been looking at me kind of a lot all week.  I would be creeped out by it, but it's nothing compared to the way Michael looks at me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Spamster!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, Pam plus Spam plus...?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hamster.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Welcome back!  How was your vacation?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It was great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm-hm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you get lucky?  Oh!  Boink!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Roy and I just got back from the Poconos.  I get ten vacation days a year, and I try to hold off taking them for as long as possible, and this year I got to the third week in January.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am Pam.  Spicoli guy.  Oh, God.  Names, numbers.  Okay. [walking into office] Whoa!  God!  Yuck, yuck.  Yuck.  Yuck!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow!  What happened in there?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There is stink in there, my God!  What is... what is that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [looking at pile on Michel's carpet] Oh... I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is it a bird?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I don't think it's a bird.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, God!  How could that happen?  How could... right in the middle of the carpet.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What's goin' on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, somebody vomited right in the middle of the carpet in my office.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [taking a look] I don't think that's vomit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Check it out.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Check it out.  Don't be a wuss, just get... no, I'm not holding your coffee.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, that's ridiculous.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is it?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael. [tapping on door]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is it?  No, just tell me what it is.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [pounding on door] Michael, I ... I ... I gotta get outta here.  I can't hold my breath that long.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Open the door up!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It smelled terrible.

quotes.speaker: {Pam} and others
quotes.text: [after going in to check out the smell]  Phew.  Oh!  No, mm-mm. [leaving quickly]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I cannot believe a pipe burst and left that in there.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: That's no burst pipe.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How do you know that?  What is it, then?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Hi guys.  Somebody makin' soup?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [as cleaning lady with mask leaves] Here she comes.  All cleaned?  Great. [walks into office]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [coughing] It's still stinky.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is worse.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: She probably scrubbed it into the fibers of the carpet.  Total permeation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [while in his reeking office]  I am a big Fear Factor fan.  I'm a big fan of anything Joe Rogan does, actually, so this is sort of like my audition tape.  Um... [clearing throat]   I can't stand it [gets up to leave], I can't stay in here another second.  No!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey!  Welcome back!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thanks!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, how was the resort?  Did you ski a lot?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A little.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good!  What's goin' on here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?  I did not do that.  That sounds disgusting.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [barely stifling laughter] It wasn't me.  Um... it wasn't me. [regaining composure] It was not me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [smelling the stink] Oh.  Wow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [giggles at Roy]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sitting at Jim's desk]  Hey Jim.  I thought that we would be desk buddies while they changed my carpet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That might be a little difficult with the one computer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh... It's ...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But there's definitely a desk open in the back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [reluctantly] Yeah ...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: ...which I guess I'll be taking.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no!  Seriously, I don't mind sharing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no, no, seriously, I'll be in the back.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Are you moving back here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, just for the day while Michael's at my desk.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Because Toby used to sit there, but he had to move over there because of an allergy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Allergy to... the desk?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [shaking head] Weird.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [putting his feet on desk] Yeah, yeah, yeah.  Old bullpen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [putting his feet on desk] Ha ha ha... the old bullpen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't ape me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The pressures of my office are insane.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [agreeing] Mm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just... you couldn't understand, but man, you guys have it so easy out here, you know?  I used to sit right here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No way!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And who had your office?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ed Truck. [exclaiming is disgust]  Ed Truck was the manager before me.  Horrible.  He hated fun.  It was like, "Oh, Ed Truck is walking toward us.  Stop having fun.  Start pretending to do work."  What a jerk.  He's... You know what?  I swore to myself that if I ever got to walk around the room as manager, people would laugh when they saw me coming and would applaud as I walked away.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [to Jim] I'm serious.  My closet doors will not shut.  I mean, it only takes so long to measure to make sure that clothes will hang up because aren't all hangers like that big?  So I don't understand why the closet engineer didn't think of that.  So now I'm doing this new thing where I just leave piles of clothes on the floor and then I walk around the piles to get an outfit...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know who used to sit at that desk?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That guy Miles who quit to form his own company?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-mm.  Todd Packer.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I thought he was out on the road.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He was, but, uh... that desk was empty.  He'd come in and sit there sometimes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I was in training, many years ago... not so long ago... I worked side-by-side with a fellow named Todd Packer, and together we rocked the office [picture behind Michael falls].  Packer and I once spent the whole day with our pants off, and when people noticed, we convinced them that they were crazy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will gladly pay you Tuesday for a hamburger today.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [on phone] Excuse me one second, please. [to Michael] What is it that you need right now that you can't wait until I'm off the phone with a customer?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, a customer, well, sound the alarm. [laughs] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Another time, Packer held this guy's head in the toilet for like a minute.  Guy had no sense of humor about it.  Probably why he wasn't hired.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [after Michael punches him in the arm] What did you hit me for?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Charley horse!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Charley horse!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: You shouldn't have hit me, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, okay.  Gah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Once, as a joke, Packer banged every chick in the office. [giggles]  It was hysterical.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [to Jim] Beyonce, pink the color, Pink the person, hot dogs, basically anything that is awesome. Snow cones...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey Jim, Michael wanted me to ask you how to raise your desk chair.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's the lever on the side.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That's what I told him.  Thanks. [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh my God, he is so cute!  Would you talk to him for me and see if he likes me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I don't think I can...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, please Jim?  Please, please, Jim.  Please, please, please?  He's so cute.  I like him so much.  And I would do it, but I'm too shy.  Please, Jim, please, please, please, please, Jim. Please, please, please...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [whispering] Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispering] Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's send up Accounting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Old fashioned raid.  Sales on Accounting.  Yeah.  Follow my lead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey guys.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ahem.  What's up?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: {Michael} and {Dwight}
quotes.text: [as they throw accountants' files and supplies around] Ahhhh!  Whoo hoo!  Come on, come on, come on, come on!  Sales rules!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah! [laughing]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah! Oh ho ho [laughing]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Should we help 'em pick up their stuff?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no.  We don't do that.  We don't do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Watch out, Pam. You're next!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You're gonna throw my things on the ground?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What happened in Michael's office was wrong.  I understand it [chuckles], it makes sense [regains composure]  But it... it was still wrong.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why would somebody ruin a perfectly good carpet?  I don't know.  It could be done out of hate.  It could be done out of love.  It could be completely neutral.  Maybe somebody hates the cleaning lady.  And, well, she doesn't do a very good job, obviously, because my office still reeks like you would not believe.  I hate her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what?  I am beginning to think that what happened to my carpet was an act of terrorism against the office.  The only thing that makes any sense.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on phone] Hello, am I the 107th caller? [hangs up, dials again] Hello, Rock 107.  Am I the 107th caller? [hangs up and dials again] Hell , Rock 107.  Am I the 107th caller? [hangs up and begins to dial again] I'm totally gonna win us that box set.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jethro Tull...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop it. [Dwight hangs up] Stop.  It.  [Dwight beings to dial] Don't.  Don't.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I need to make a sales call.  Please?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on phone, whispering] Am I the 107th caller?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Roy in Jim's earshot] ...back so soon.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: We can go back in, like, a couple of weeks maybe.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, right.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Okay, maybe another month, like, maybe for, like President's Day or something.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, that's right.  We could do a three-day weekend.  I wonder if I could, like, call in sick on the Friday.  Then I get a four-day weekend.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [to unseen co-worker] But it's so weird to fall asleep.  And I just hate it.  'Cause I try to go to bed at, like, 9:30.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Roy as Jim escapes into bathroom] Are you kidding?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi, guys.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: We haven't finished getting things in order from your last visit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm just walking around.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Were you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's just that we're really swamped over here, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, and I'm not?  Why would you say that? Because I'm having fun?  You guys just are workin' for the weekend, aren't you?  I'm workin' for the week.  Sales team, listen to me.  This is what we're gonna do.  I'm gonna up the ante a little bit literally.  Right here, I'm gonna put a crisp one hundred dollar bill.  The person with the most sales at the end of the day gets to keep the cash.  Sound good?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [counting cash] Seventy, eighty, one, two three.  Eighty-three dollars.  Still a lotta money and I'm going to ... [moves money after seeing workmen walk by] ... I'm gonna leave it right over here where everybody can see it.  I will be taking Jim's clients today because he is not here and out of sight, out of the contest.  Let's see who winds up with the cash, shall we?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You're gonna compete against us?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, it is on, Phyllis, it is so on!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It is so on!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: God, this is gonna be fun.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael is gonna wipe the floor with us!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] So you have 40 boxes going out, and I will deliver those personally in a Sebring.  Very good, nice doing business with you.  Thank you. [hangs up] Yes! [chuckles] Oh, yeah!  Read it and weep.  Oh!  Oh, look at that! [puts post-it on Phyllis' forehead]  Look at me, Phyllis!  Oh, what is that?  That's my sale! [humming then dancing victoriously]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [walking by with new carpet] What... What's that?  Whatcha doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [stops dance] Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [laughing] I think he's dancing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.  Just ...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That was definitely not dancing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, guys?  It's none of your concern.  It was official business, so just...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Paper business.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, paper business.  Is this done?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Extreme Home Makeover puts together a house in an hour.  If you were on that crew, you would be fired like that. [snaps]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Somebody did something bad to Michael's carpet. Maybe that's all we need to know.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [to Oscar] Who do you think did it?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Are you kidding?  I thought it was you.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Really?  I thought you. [both laugh in Michael's earshot]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This was no act of God.  A person did this.  A person who works in this office.  Maybe all of them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what?  Today is not a good day for a sales contest.  We're... we're not... we're not doin' this today.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That doesn't seem fair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You wanna talk about fair?  Does anyone need to smell my old carpet?  You explain to me how that was fair, and I'll explain to you how this is fair.  Plus I just... I think that picking today was sort of taking advantage.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But you're the one who picked today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am a victim of a hate crime.  Stanley knows what I'm talkin' about.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: That's not what a hate crime is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well I hated it!  A lot!  Okay, I... you know what?  If the guilty person would just come forward and take their punishment, we'd be done . [no one comes forward]  Very well.  Then you are all punished.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What's our punishment?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're all on a time out.  Just sit there quietly. [phone rings, Phyllis reaches to answer]  No.  NO!  [phone continues to ring]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What's up?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nothing much.  Let me ask you something.  It's actually little awkward.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What do you think of Kelly?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don't know.  Depends if you like a little junk in ... [notices camera] Umm... She's really cool.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are you interested in her?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, totally.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Did she say something?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She said lots of things.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Do you know if she's looking for a long-term thing or if she'd be cool just hangin' out?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I have no idea.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Can you find out?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.  Sure.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [to Jim] Oh, long-term, definitely.  Fall in love, have babies, spend every second together... but don't tell him that, okay?  Just tell him I'm, like, up for anything.  I mean, I'm not a slut, but who knows?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you remember Ed Truck?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Sure.  He hired me.  How's he doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How would I know?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I thought you might.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My biggest fear is turning into him.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Michael, you should have much bigger fears than that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs]  I wasn't talking literally, Creed.  Yeah, being buried alive would be worse. Happy?  Why am I talking to you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [meeting Ed Truck in parking lot] Ed?  Hi.  Thanks for meeting me.  Must be kinda neat comin' back.

quotes.speaker: Ed Begley
quotes.text: Yeah.  Should we go upstairs?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, well, honestly Ed, I really don't wanna be up there right now.

quotes.speaker: Ed Begley
quotes.text: So, what's the problem with my pension?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, no, no, no.  You're good.  It was clerical.  You're good.  Um, well, somebody did something in my office, and I now think that they did it on purpose and it was directed at me.

quotes.speaker: Ed Begley
quotes.text: Well, what was done?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn't get a good look at... it, but it smells horrible.

quotes.speaker: Ed Begley
quotes.text: Yeah, somebody once did that in my office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Ed Begley
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that figures.  So how did you deal with people not liking you?

quotes.speaker: Ed Begley
quotes.text: You can't expect to be friends with everybody.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well... s-sure I can.

quotes.speaker: Ed Begley
quotes.text: No.  They'll always think of you as a boss first.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not necessarily.  You can love a boss like you do a father.

quotes.speaker: Ed Begley
quotes.text: I'm not sure that ever happens.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, okay.  Different management styles.

quotes.speaker: Ed Begley
quotes.text: Why can't your workers be your workers, family be your family, your friends be your friends?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Last week I would have given a kidney to anyone in this office.  I would have reached right into my stomach and pulled it out for them.  But now, no.  I don't have the relationship with these people that I thought I did.  I hope they ask, so they can hear me say, "Uh... no. I only give my organs to my real friends.  Go get yourself a monkey kidney."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] Hey, Brenda.  This is, uh, Jim Halpert from the boat.  And I got your number from the corporate directory and, well, I was assuming that you probably gave it to them because you wanted me to ask you out, right?  Um, so gimme a call back.  You can get my number from said directory, um, or just check your e-mail 'cause I just sent you one.  Yikes.  Uh... give me a call back, I hope.  I'll talk to you later. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You just asked a girl out on the phone!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] Yes.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Hello, yes. I'm looking for a gay nerd named Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who is this?  How did you get this number?

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Your mom, you gay nerd!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my God.  Packer.  Packster.  Whacky Pack.  How you doin'?

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Hey, did you get that package I left for you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh... no.  Did anybody see a package here today?  No.  How big was it?

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: It was pretty big.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you see a big package?  Where did you leave it?

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Left it in the middle of your office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? Guys, did you see a big package in my office?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: You mean the thing?

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [laughs uproariously]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you kidding me?  Oh!

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Special delivery!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was Packer!  Oh, you're... you are dead.  You are dead, my friend!  That is hilar... Oh, God!  Of course it was you.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Sit on the throne, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.  [laughs and claps] Yeah, yeah!  Oh my God.  It was Packer!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It takes an advanced sense of humor.  I don't expect everybody to understand.  It was done out of love, just like I thought.  It's ah... God, these people are so... these are good people.  We have fun. [giggles] We just have fun!  Oh, I'm just so sorry that I threw the thing out.

quotes.speaker: {Jim}'s Voicemail
quotes.text: You have seven unheard messages.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim] Hey, Jim.  It's Pam.  I keep looking up to say something to you and then Michael's there and it's horrible.  Anyway, I'm bored.  Come back!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim] Hey, guess what?  I moved my computer so I can't see Michael's head.  It's working.  I think I can have a career as a very specific type of decorator.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim]  Sudoku. Level moderate. 18 minutes. Suck on that, Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim] I'll transfer you.  Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam.  Hold, please.  Dunder Mifflin, this is ... okay, sorry.  Michael was standing at my desk, and I needed to be busy or who knows what would've happened, so thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim] Hey, what's that word we made up when you have a thing stuck in your shoe?  Anyway, I have a thing stuck in my shoe.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim] Hey, I have a chance to sneak out of here early, and I'm not messing this up, so I'll see you tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim] Calling from my cell phone.  I don't know if you guys figured out who did that to Michael's carpet yet, but I have a theory that involves an inter-departmental conspiracy.  Everybody in the office.  We need to talk.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think this whole disaster on Michael's carpet happened for a good reason. Him sitting next to me is a huge gift. This girl I know would say that it was a gift from God, but I don't know about all that.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Obviously, this was Kevin. This is his sense of humor exactly.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: There are so many people with motives, even me. Almost everyone is a suspect. Whoever did this is a genius. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That looks, cool, where is that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That hotel, it looks so romantic.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, just somewhere in the Poconos. I was just surfing.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I went with my parents to the Shadowbrook Farm once. That was also really romantic. Oh, my God, I wish a boy would take me there. I would need a fun new top. You know what a great color is on me? Lavender, actually.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just give me one second. I'm just gonna grab something to eat.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, you used to share that cubicle with Kelly, right?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And then you just changed desks, right?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: To one without a cubicle.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, you just couldn't take it anymore, huh?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, that's how it's gonna be.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Honestly, I don't even hear her anymore. It's like waves crashing against the beach.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on the phone] Okay, that quantity of cotton fiber will cost you... my screen disappeared. I know. I will click on the bottom and... Yes. I'm getting one of those little hourglass things. Used to have a price chart on the wall, now it's a little hourglass thing with an arrow next to it. Now it's just an hourglass thing. Uh-huh, yeah, well, or I can call you back. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone] Excellent, good, good. Well, our truck is going out first thing tomorrow morning. So...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: ...cases of typical format and coated white paper. Okay, thanks again so much. All right, bye-bye.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: 20 cartons of it's coming, on it's way.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What's going on? Anything here?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, yes. What yes? A sale or a lead or...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: A sale.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah. Small?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Big.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Huge?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Just big.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Would you say the sale that I made earlier was huge or...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Big.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone] Good. No, I completely understand, times are a little tight right now. If it's alright with you though, I will just give you a call back next month. Great, thank you so much. Goodbye.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What was that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You call that a sales call? My God, what have they been teaching you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're the one who trained me, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well, did I teach you to roll over like a submissive dog?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You most certainly did not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I did not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What can I do better?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Exactly, ask me, which you did, so, tell a joke.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm not good at jokes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you know a joke?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My cousin Mose told me a joke.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Call a client right now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And tell him the joke.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I will.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Strike while the iron's hot. A joke always works.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone] Yes, Howard Gruber, please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just sell it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone] Howard, hello. Dwight Schrute. Dunder Mifflin. Yes, and you are my favorite client. Listen, I'm calling you to tell you a little joke. What is black and white and red and can't think? A nun who has a beet for a head. ... No, I'm Catholic, too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Give me the phone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone] I understand.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Give me the phone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone] If I was offensive in any way, I...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tell him. Tell him that your supervisor is on the line.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone] Humor works in...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The old one two. Let's do it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone] ...crazy ways. I'm going to pass you off to my supervisor. Hold on one second. [whispering] Howard Gruber. It's Howard Gruber.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on the phone] Hey Howard. Michael Scott here. Yeah, sorry about that. Dwight is an idiot. I know. No, he's a little... Little dim. He's the janitor's brother, so...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's not true.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on the phone] Uh-huh? Yeah. Well, you know, like in a fast food restaurant, just to be nice they hire somebody who can't even find their way to work? That is Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispering] He's my best customer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on the phone] What can we do to help you out? You know what? I have a discount. Today and today only, on lightweight copier paper.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But that's my sale. This is my sale, Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on the phone] Uh-huh, yes, I can do that. Absolutely! Perfect. Oh, I'm glad it timed out that way.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What Michael doesn't understand is that when I worked in the fast food industry I was actually commended by management for the three "M"s. McService, McCompetence and McPunctuality.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [laughing] You gotta drink on that one. Too bad.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hell yeah, yeah, yeah. Mo'fo, mo'fo.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: You ready?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm. [thumping] [Roy groaning] Now you've got to drink.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, look, I know what you're gonna say. That I'm not standing up for myself. But you know what? It's complicated and I really don't appreciate all the badgering.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You could out-sell Michael any day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I really thought these people were my friends. My best friend since kindergarten, Elliot, that's a friend. Best friend ever. I should call him. Wonder where he lives.
